Package io.github.thatgarlicdude.pacio.file

Class PacDirectory

java.lang.Object
io.github.thatgarlicdude.pacio.file.PacObject
io.github.thatgarlicdude.pacio.file.PacDirectory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Loadable, Savable
public final class PacDirectory extends PacObject implements Loadable, Savable
A class that represents a directory in a file system.

This class extends from PacObject, keeping its file path variable and the methods related to it. But because this class is treated like a directory in the file system, it features new variables and methods that are unique to it and is related to directories in the system's disk.

  • Constructor Details

    • PacDirectory

      protected PacDirectory(Path path)
      Creates a new PacDirectory using a file path.

      This does not automatically open the PacDirectory when created. If the PacDirectory is created and needs to be opened, calling open() from the object will do the trick.

      The sole parameter, path, cannot be null. Otherwise, it will throw the IllegalArgumentException if this happens.

      Parameters:
      path - the file path to the directory in the system's disk.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if path is null.

  • Method Details

    • open

      public void open() throws IOException
      Opens the directory from the system's disk.

      This will load the entries that are within the directory to memory as PacFile objects. But this method does not open them upon creating them.

      Specified by:
      open in interface Loadable
      Specified by:
      open in class PacObject
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading from disk fails.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the directory and its files, freeing everything from memory.

      What this will do is close every file entry, freeing their bytes from memory. Then the files list will be cleared.

      Specified by:
      close in interface Loadable
      Specified by:
      close in class PacObject

    • save

      public void save() throws IOException
      Saves the file entries within the directory to the system's disk.

      Because directories cannot be saved, only the file entries can be overwritten with their bytes. Additionally, only the PacFile objects that are currently opened can be saved to the system's disk.

      Specified by:
      save in interface Savable
      Specified by:
      save in class PacObject
      Throws:
      IOException - if writing from disk fails.

    • getFiles

      public final List<PacFile> getFiles()
      Returns an unmodifiable list of files in the PacDirectory.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of files.

    • find

      public final PacFile find(String name)
      Finds a specific file within the directory.

      If the method cannot find a file entry that matches the name, it will return null instead.

      Parameters:
      name - the file name that the method will look for.
      Returns:
      the PacFile that matches the name.

    • from

      public static PacDirectory from(Path path) throws IOException
      Creates a new PacDirectory using a file path, and automatically opens it, loading its entries to memory.
      Parameters:
      path - the file path to the directory in the system's disk.
      Returns:
      a PacDirectory that's automatically opened.
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading from disk fails.
